If you sign up for our newsletter, you’ll get her letter before everyone else.When you think about your favorite cookies, what comes to mind? I feel like I have at least three: a cozy-coffee-shop cookie (Culture Espresso’s chocolate chip, served-hot), overachiever help-me-win-the-cookie-swap cookie (tricolores), and fancy cafe cookie (Té Company’s perfect pineapple linzer torte).But in my heart, when I think about my favorite cookies, bar none, they’re always the ones that bring me back to childhood—the Danish butter cookies in that royal blue tin, the big sugar cookies with royal icing and colored sprinkles that I’d get from the bakery in my hometown as a treat, the oatmeal chocolate chip ones I’d make with my mom (and, true to kid form, would sneak plenty of batter from along the way).Want this letter before it hits the website? Sign up for our newsletter!Sarah Jampel's buttery, jam-filled tahini linzer torte bars.
Photograph by Laura Murray, food styling by Sue LiWhich is why I am so excited that the holiday cookie package in this year’s Holiday Issue (subscribe here!) is all about cookie nostalgia. Our recipe developers looked back at the cookies they loved the most growing up and upgraded them for our 2020 lives: more sprinkles, more chocolate, more nuts, more pizzazz. They range from fudgy bittersweet pizzettes and gingery marranitos enfiestados to a super-fun Fig Newton upgrade with tahini and beautiful brown butter and pistachio sables, and I think I love them all.I’d love to hear what cookies you’re baking or ordering or hoping to be sent this year, and whether that’s tradition for you or something new you’re trying this holiday season.
